MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: MDS-Unified Parkinsons Disease Rating Scale: Part 2 (MDS-UPDRS: Part 2)

updrs2_01.Description: Over the past week, have you had problems with your speech?

Levels.1: Slight: My speech is soft, slurred or uneven, but it does not cause others to ask me to repeat myself
Levels.2: Mild: My speech causes people to ask me to occasionally repeat myself, but not every day
Levels.3: Moderate: My speech is unclear enough that others ask me to repeat myself every day even though most of my speech is understood
Levels.4: Severe: Most or all of my speech cannot be understood

updrs2_02.Description: Over the past week, have you usually had too much saliva during when you are awake or when you sleep?

Levels.1: Slight: I have too much saliva, but do not drool
Levels.2: Mild: I have some drooling during sleep, but none when I am awake
Levels.3: Moderate: I have some drooling when I am awake, but I usually do not need tissues or a handkerchief
Levels.4: Severe: I have so much drooling that I regularly need to use tissues or a handkerchief to protect my clothes

updrs2_03.Description: Over the past week, have you usually had problems swallowing pills or eating meals? Do you need your pills cut or crushed or your meals to be made soft, chopped, or blended to avoid choking?

Levels.1: Slight: I am aware of slowness in my chewing or increased effort at swallowing, but I do not choke or need to have my food specially prepared
Levels.2: Mild: I need to have my pills cut or my food specially prepared because of chewing or swallowing problems, but I have not choked over the past week
Levels.3: Moderate: I choked at least once in the past week
Levels.4: Severe: Because of chewing and swallowing problems, I need a feeding tube

updrs2_04.Description: Over the past week, have you usually had troubles handling your food and using eating utensils? For example, do you have trouble handling finger foods or using forks, knives, spoons, chopsticks?

Levels.1: Slight: I am slow, but I do not need any help handling my food and have not had food spills while eating
Levels.2: Mild: I am slow with my eating and have occasional food spills. I may need help with a few tasks such as cutting meat
Levels.3: Moderate: I need help with many eating tasks but can manage some alone
Levels.4: Severe: I need help for most or all eating tasks

updrs2_05.Description: Over the past week, have you usually had problems dressing? For example, are you slow or do you need help with buttoning, using zippers, putting on or taking off your clothes or jewelry?

Levels.1: Mild: I am slow, but I do not need help
Levels.2: Moderate: I am slow and need help for a few dressing tasks (buttons, bracelets)
Levels.3: Moderate: I need help for many dressing tasks
Levels.4: Severe: I need help for most or all dressing tasks

updrs2_06.Description: Over the past week, have you usually been slow or do you need help with washing, bathing, shaving, brushing teeth, combing your hair, or with other personal hygiene?

Levels.1: Slight: I am slow, but I do not need any help
Levels.2: Mild: I need someone else to help me with some hygiene tasks
Levels.3: Moderate: I need help for many hygiene tasks
Levels.4: Severe: I need help for most or all of my hygiene tasks

updrs2_07.Description: Over the past week, have people usually had trouble reading your handwriting?

Levels.1: Slight: My writing is slow, clumsy or uneven, but all words are clear
Levels.2: Mild: Some words are unclear and difficult to read
Levels.3: Moderate: Many words are unclear and difficult to read
Levels.4: Severe: Most or all words cannot be read

updrs2_08.LongName: UPDRS 2.8: Doing hobbies and other activities
updrs2_08.Description: Over the past week, have you usually had trouble doing your hobbies or other things that you like to do?

Levels.1: Slight: I am a bit slow but do these activities easily
Levels.2: Mild: I have some difficulty doing these activities
Levels.3: Moderate: I have major problems doing these activities, but still do most
Levels.4: Severe: I am unable to do most or all of these activities

updrs2_09.Description: Over the past week, do you usually have trouble turning over in bed?

Levels.0: Severe: I am unable to turn over without help from someone else

updrs2_10.Description: Over the past week, have you usually had shaking or tremor?

Levels.0: Normal: Not at all. I have no shaking or tremor
Levels.1: Slight: Shaking or tremor occurs but does not cause problems with any activities
Levels.2: Mild: Shaking or tremor causes problems with only a few activities
Levels.3: Moderate: Shaking or tremor causes problems with many of my daily activities
Levels.4: Severe: Shaking or tremor causes problems with most or all activities

updrs2_11.LongName: UPDRS 2.11: Getting out of bed, a car or a deep chair
updrs2_11.Description: Over the past week, have you usually had trouble getting out of bed, a car seat, or a deep chair?

Levels.1: Slight: I am slow or awkward, but I usually can do it on my first try
Levels.2: Mild: I need more than one try to get up or need occasional help
Levels.3: Moderate: I sometimes need help to get up, but most times I can still do it on my own
Levels.4: Severe: I need help most or all of the time

updrs2_12.Description: Over the past week, have you usually had problems with balance and walking?

Levels.1: Slight: I am slightly slow or may drag a leg. I never use a walking aid
Levels.2: Mild: I occasionally use a walking aid, but I do not need any help from another person
Levels.3: Moderate: I usually use a walking aid (cane, walker) to walk safely without falling. However, I do not usually need the support of another person
Levels.4: Severe: I usually use the support of another person to walk safely without falling

updrs2_13.Description: Over the past week, on your usual day when walking, do you suddenly stop or freeze as if your feet are stuck to the floor?

Levels.1: Slight: I briefly freeze, but I can easily start walking again. I do not need help from someone else or a walking aid (cane or walker) because of freezing
Levels.2: Mild: I freeze and have trouble starting to walk again, but I do not need someone?s help or a walking aid (cane or walker) because of freezing
Levels.3: Moderate: When I freeze I have a lot of trouble starting to walk again and, because of freezing, I sometimes need to use a walking aid or need someone else?s help
Levels.4: Severe: Because of freezing, most or all of the time, I need to use a walking aid or someone?s help
